title: President suspends Mannar Wind Power Projects amid local concerns
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has ordered the temporary suspension of two proposed wind power plants in the Mannar area a 20 MW facility and a 50 MW project despite tenders being called and contracts already awarded.

title: Three National Hospitals run without Directors
byline: Three major national hospitals in Sri Lanka have been operating without permanent directors for more than six months, health sector sources said.

title: Elderly man beaten to death over a stolen chocolate
byline: A 67-year-old man with a fondness for chocolates was brutally assaulted to death in Peradeniya after allegedly stealing a small slab of chocolate from a shop.

title: WhatsApp hacking wave hits Sri Lanka: many targeted in OTP scam spree
byline: A sharp rise in WhatsApp account hacking has alarmed digital security authorities in Sri Lanka, with the Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT) reporting 64 complaint cases so far this year. Officials believe the actual number is far higher, as many incidents go unreported.

title: Foreigners can use train tickets purchased from agents till August 31: Deputy Minister
byline: In the wake of the ticket controversy on the Ella Odyssey train, Deputy Minister of Transport Prasanna Gunasena said foreigners who had purchased tickets from agents at higher prices could travel in the train until August 31 after proving their identity and paying the due penalty.

title: IGP vows legal action against politicians linked to underworld
byline: Newly appointed Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasuriya revealed that politicians supporting underworld figures and drug traffickers have already been identified and will face legal action in due course.

title: New Chairmen for BOC, ITN and state bodies
byline: The Committee on High Posts has approved several high-level appointments, including the appointment of four new chairmen to major state institutions.

title: Another statutory body chairman resigns
byline: Janatha Estates Development Board (JEDB) Chairman Jayantha Thilakarathne has tendered his resignation, effective August 15.

title: Major renovations begin at Parliament after 42 years
byline: Large-scale renovations of the Parliament of Sri Lanka have commenced for the first time in more than four decades, under the guidance of Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne and with Cabinet approval.

title: 400 containers of salt stuck at port
byline: The Sri Lanka Salt Producers Association (SLSPA) has urged the government to enforce the country’s packaging law on Indian salt packets currently distributed locally and to immediately release 400 containers of salt that have been held at the Colombo Port for 45 days.

title: Army donates laptops to university students
byline: The Directorate of Welfare of the Sri Lanka Army conducted a special donation programme at Army headquarters to provide laptops to government university students who are children of serving Army personnel.

title: Over 5,000 T56 cartridges unearthed from Getalawa canal bed
byline: Galenbindunuwewa Police have recovered a cache of ammunition from the bed of the Getalawa Canal during a search operation launched following public information.

title: Bribery Commission arrests SSP Satish Gamage
byline: Acting Director of the Police Cultural Division, Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Satish Gamage, has been arrested by officers from the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Foreign cannabis cultivation plan draws ADIC warning
byline: The Alcohol and Drug Information Centre (ADIC) has voiced strong concerns over the government’s decision to allow seven foreign investors to cultivate cannabis in Sri Lanka under the Board of Investment (BOI).

title: Deadly wildfires cause chaos across Europe as thousands evacuated
byline: Farm animals and pets rushed to safety as Greek wildfire plagues port cityScroll back up to restore default view.

title: SSP Satish Gamage remanded
byline: Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Sathish Gamagedara, attached to the Cultural Division of the Police Field Force Headquarters, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, was ordered to be remanded until August 19 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Pavithra Sanjeewani Pathirana.
